clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Dynamic Soft Tissue Mobilization in Reducing Hamstring Tightness in Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Dynamic Soft Tissue Mobilization vs Proprioceptive Neuromuscular Facilitation in Reducing Hamstring Muscle Tightness in Patients With Knee Osteoarthritis: a Randomized Control Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
OBJECTIVE: To evaluate the effectiveness of dynamic soft tissue mobilization in comparison with the proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation (hold-relax) technique in reducing hamstring muscle tightness, pain and improving physical functions in patients with knee osteoarthritis (OA) by using Visual Analog Scale (VAS), Active Knee Extension Angle Test (AKET) and Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS).
METHODOLOGY: A single blinded randomized control trial will be carried out at MSK OPD of IPM&R, DUHS, Karachi. Data collection will be started after the approval of Institutional Review Board of Dow University of Health Sciences, Karachi. After screening by consultant physiatrist, based on inclusion and exclusion criteria, forty-eight (n=48) patients who will fulfill clinical plus radiographic classification criteria of ACR (American College of Rheumatology) for osteoarthritis of the knee, will be enrolled in the study. After describing the study objectives to participants and taking formal consent from them, the assessment forms will be used to collect the data. Participants will randomly allocate and equally divided into 2 groups i.e. 24 in interventional group 'A' and 24 in interventional group 'B'. The interventional group 'A' will be received dynamic soft tissue mobilization on hamstring muscle along with cryotherapy on knee joint and isometric strengthening exercises for knee osteoarthritis while the interventional group 'B' will be received proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation (hold relax) technique on hamstring muscle along with cryotherapy on knee joint and isometric strengthening exercises for knee osteoarthritis. Twelve sessions will be given each of 30 minutes. Baseline and post treatment assessment will be carried out by independent assessor, other than the principal investigator who will give the intervention, to measure outcomes by using visual analog scale (VAS), active knee extension angle test (AKEA) and knee injury osteoarthritis outcome score (KOOS). The study will be conducted within six months right after synopsis approval.

detailed_description.textblock:
STUDY DESIGN:
A randomized control trial.
STUDY SETTING:
Study will be conducted in musculoskeletal OPD of Sindh Institute of Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation, Karachi.
STUDY DURATION:
Estimated time will be six months just after the synopsis approval.
STUDY POPULATION:
Knee osteoarthritis patients fulfilling inclusion criteria will be enrolled in the study.
INCLUSION CRITERIA
- Both genders
- Subjects with 40 years of age and above
- Patients with hamstring tightness
- ACR clinical + radiological classification criteria for knee osteoarthritis
EXCLUSION CRITERIA
- Patients with positive sciatic nerve test (SLR)
- Patients with neurological disorder impacting on lower extremity
- Musculoskeletal knee deformity e.g. varus
- Patients with lower limb internal fixation
- History of previous lower limb arthroplasty or another knee surgery
- Patients with history of infectious disease or malignancy effecting the lower extremity .
- Using assistive device(stick/cane)
- History of spinal surgery
- Patient having low backache or sciatica
SAMPLE SIZE:
A sample size of 48 patients (24 in one group) is calculated by using open epi software version 3, Paired Means Power Analysis with 99% Confidence Interval and 95% power of test, mean ± S.D of VAS 5.27 ± 0.8 in group A and 3.81±1.4 in group B
SAMPLING TECHNIQUE:
It will be non-probability purposive sampling.
DATA COLLECTION :
Data will be collected just after the IRB approval. After physician referral and screening, those 48 patients will be enrolled in the study who will fulfilling the inclusion criteria. Informed consent will be signed from all participants after given the brief description of study objectives, information about treatment, possible risk and benefits of treatment through an informed sheet which will be translated into Urdu language for the comprehension of the participant. Each selected subject will go for random allocation by using randomization software generated random list in one of the two treatment groups with different interventions. The assessor will be a physiotherapist other than the principal investigator and will be blinded to the intervention type of patient which will be assessed. Outcome measures will be analyzed by the active knee extension angle test (AKEA test) for assessing hamstring flexibility, visual analogue scale (VAS) for pain assessment and Knee injury and osteoarthritis outcome score (KOOS) for physical functions. Assessment will be done on baseline and will reevaluate after 4 weeks treatment on 12th session. 4 weeks treatment for every patient of each group in alternate days i.e. 12 sessions, each will be of 30 minutes. Every attempt will be done within ethical constraints in obtaining and recording outcome data.
Additionally. In case of any aggravation in symptoms, patients will be allowed to take similar analgesics and muscle relaxants prescribed by the referring consultant.
STUDY VARIABLES
Dependent (outcome variables):
- Knee extension angle test
- Visual analog scale
- Knee injury and osteoarthritis outcome score (KOOS)
- Knee Extension range (°)
Independent variables:
- Age
- Gender
- Weight
- Dynamic soft tissue mobilization
- PNF stretching exercises
STATISTICAL ANALYSES:
The data analysis software which will be used is IBM SPSS Base Licensed version 21. Mean ± SD will be calculated for quantitative variables like age. For qualitative variables, there will be calculation of percentage and frequency. The outcomes of the study, pain intensity, muscle tightness and range of motion (ROM) will be recorded at baseline and after treatment and then comparison will be done between the groups.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A single blinded randomized control trial in which total 48 patients will be enrolled and randomly allocated into 2 interventional groups equally. The randomization will be carried out through an open source software "research randomizer" by statistician.
study_design_info.masking_description: Other than the principal investigator, another physiotherapist will work as outcomes assessor who will blind to the intervention type given to the patient who will be assessed.

primary_outcome.description: A bidirectional scale for subjective measurement for pain comprises of a 10 cm line labeling parallel on both sides, starts with least "no pain" and end on most "worst pain"
It will used to assessing the hamstring muscle length by using goniometry with 90° of hip flexion.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS)
secondary_outcome.description: KOOS is a patient related outcome measure, having 5 subscales, designed to check disease development and outcomes followed by surgical, pharmaceutical, physical therapy or other interventions.

arm_group.description: Dynamic soft tissue mobilization (DSTM) is a soft tissue mobilization technique use to treat tight spasm using progressive muscle activation.
PNF stretching technique, a type of flexibility training that is effective in improving muscle flexibility and restore functional ranges using a wide array of techniques.

intervention.description: Dynamic soft tissue mobilization will be given in the following sequence, In supine position with 90˚ flexion of knee and hip joint deep longitudinal strokes will be applied from distal to proximal direction along with the tightened area of hamstring while passively stretching the hamstring. Total 5 longitudinal strokes will be applied followed by shaking for 20 seconds. Then progressed to the next dynamic technique in the above-mentioned sequence but the patient will be asked to do leg extension actively to achieve reciprocal inhibition of the hamstring muscle. In The next step, the subject will apply a force to the therapist's hand to engage the hamstring eccentrically as the muscle will be lengthened to its end range. In that position, the therapist will apply 5 deep longitudinal strokes from the distal towards the proximal direction on tight hamstring muscles.

The position of the patient will be supine lying with 90⁰ flexion of hip. Therapist will passively extend the knee joint where patient will feel a mild stretch. Then therapist will ask the patient to do knee flexion in counter resistance applied by the therapist by using about 50% of his maximum strength and isometric contraction of hamstring muscles will be achieved. Patient will maintain that isometric contraction for 8 seconds then relax on therapist command. Just after relaxation therapist will further stretch the hamstring muscle to the point of mild to moderate painless stretch and patient will hold it for 30 seconds. Three repetitions will be applied in each session.
application of cold pack on knee joint for 10 minutes

i. Isometric hip adductors exercises in crook lying: Two sets of 10 repetitions with a 10-seconds hold will be carried out. ii. Isometric quadriceps strengthening exercises in supine lying: A towel roll underneath the knee joint will be used to perform this exercise. Two sets of 10 repetitions with a 10-seconds hold will be performed.
